description: This file defines the DietaryPreferencesFragment class, which displays UI components for dietary preferences and restrictions as focusable chips within an Android app. It manages focus behavior, styling, and user interactions such as opening a map modal dialog.

classes.name: DietaryPreferencesFragment
classes.description: A Fragment that displays dietary preference and restriction chips, styled with focus handling and opens a modal dialog.

methods.name: onCreateView
methods.description: Inflates the fragment layout and initializes focusable chips for preferences and restrictions, setting up focus behaviors and interactions.

methods.name: applyChipFocusBehavior
methods.description: Sets up click and focus change listeners for a chip to toggle selection and apply focus ring styling.

methods.name: applyFocusRing
methods.description: Applies visual focus indication and focus change effects to a view, including scaling and foreground drawable.

methods.name: showMapModal
methods.description: Creates and displays a MapModalDialog fragment, invoked when the map button is clicked.
